oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Funktionäre suchen ihr Publikum: Zeitgeschichtliche Gewerkschafterbiografie und populäre Zielgruppe
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Remeke, Stefan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biographie
Elite
Arbeiterbewegung
Deutschland
Nachkriegszeit
Gewerkschaften
Biography
Labour Movement
Germany
Post-War
Trade Union
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Although trade unions seem to have been forced onto the defensive, especially in contrast to their presence in the 1960s and 1970s, the author supports the hypothesis that there still is a public that is interested in trade unions and their history. The author tries to illustrate which elements should be included in the representation of trade union history in order to attract a broader audience. Of major importance are the perspectives that can be identified in the biographies of unionists.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Moving the Social; Vol. 45 (2011): Biografische Ansätze zur Geschichte der Arbeiterbewegung im 20. Jahrhundert; 163-180
